channel.title: 1. Getting started on Getting Started with Amazon SageMaker Studio
channel.description: Recent content in 1. Getting started on Getting Started with Amazon SageMaker Studio

item.title: 1.1 Login to your temporary workshop AWS Account
item.description: Get your temporary AWS account Click on the link at the bottom of the browser as show below. If using Windows Save file to a convenient location such as your Desktop If using MAC/Ubuntu Save file to a convenient location such as Desktop You’ll need to perform update the file’s permissions by running the code below the screenshot in your terminal Note: advanced users may optionally save it at ~/.

item.title: 1.2 Launch an Amazon EC2 DL1 instance
1.3 Launch Jupyterlab server
item.description: Launch Jupyterlab server on your DL1 instance SSH to your DL1 instance cd cd Desktop ssh -i labsuser.pem ubuntu@<PASTE_IP_ADDRESS> Note: Make sure you give the full path to the labsuser.pem file or navigate to the directory where you saved the file before running SSH Update python3 to point to python3.7 with Habana support sudo rm /usr/bin/python3 sudo ln -s /usr/bin/python3.7 /usr/bin/python3 Install Jupyterlab server pip3 install jupyterlab Jaunch Jupyterlab server and setup tunnel In the current terminal window connected to DL1 instance, run: jupyter notebook --ip='*' --NotebookApp.

item.title: 1.4 Download workshop content
item.description: Feel free to follow along with the presenter on the stage or on livestream
